page.title: 12ANNUAL EVENTS IN PILNING
page.content: {Pilning Carnival. This is an annual event previously held on May Day but changed to June hoping for warmer weather. Some months before a committee meets to arrange a programme. A band leads the procession through the village to the Playing Fields. The May Queen and attendants on a float are followed by floats decorated by groups such as Brownies, Playgroup, Pilning School and Village Players. After the floats are judged the stalls and side-shows open, run by many including Mothers and Toddlers Club, Labour Group, Playgroup and Cat Neutering Society. As the band plays in the Village Hall a puppet show and talent competitions are held. Teas are provided by the wives of the cricket club members. Profits are for the village hall fund.
